description.narrative: Governments and communities have increased capacity to prepare for and respond to disasters and adapt to climate change in the WASH sector, particularly in target countries.

mailing-address.narrative: 3rd & 5th Floors FDB Building 360 Victoria Parade Suva

sector.narrative: Risk assessment and analysis (including conflict, disaster, climate, epidemics)
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH in emergencies - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) response including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

title.narrative: Pacific Islands United Nations Sustainable Development Framwork
Pacific Islands Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Water Sanitation and Hygiene)
UNICEF Programmes in Pacific Islands (Disaster Risk Reduction)
UNICEF Programmes in Pacific Islands (Water Sanitation and hygiene)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Governments and communities have increased capacity to prepare for and respond to disasters and adapt to climate change in the WASH sector, particularly in target countries.

description.narrative: UNICEF increased the capacity of governments and communities to prepare for and respond to disasters in the WASH sector in several PICTs, including Vanuatu, Solomon Islands and Kiribati. In Vanuatu, the government is assisting over 50 communities with completed DWSSP through its capital assistance programme. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of Communities implementing water safety plans
Number of targeted population provided with hygiene kits or key hygiene items in the reporting year [COVID] - i) total

actual.value: 2020:Fiji - 20,000 RMI - 0 Vanuatu - 7,943 Solomon Islands - 2,000 FSM - 27,841 Tuvalu - 0 Kiribati - 15,304
